intro: Sebicea stipularis, commonly known as the stipular sebicea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves, which are often covered in fine, soft hairs. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Sebicea stipularis is adapted to grow in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded, forested areas.
